title: 7 New Books added to Big Book of R [7/12/2024] | R-bloggers
excerpt: I’m very happy to introduce 7 additions to the Big Book of R collection which now stands at almost 450 free, open-source R programming books. A special thanks to Gary and Lucca Scrucca for their submissions. title: Spatial Statistics for Data Science: Theory and Practice with R
excerpt: A book for Spatial Statistics for Data Science with R.

title: Welcome | Handbook of Graphs and Networks in People Analytics
excerpt: A technical manual of graphs, networks and their applications in the people and social sciences

title: R Graphics Cookbook, 2nd edition
excerpt: This cookbook contains more than 150 recipes to help scientists, engineers, programmers, and data analysts generate high-quality graphs quickly—without having to comb through all the details of R’s graphing systems. Each recipe tackles a specific problem with a solution you can apply to your own project and includes a discussion of how and why the recipe works.

title: Text Mining with R
excerpt: A guide to text analysis within the tidy data framework, using the tidytext package and other tidy tools

title: Big Book of R has over 200 books! | R-bloggers
excerpt: Way back in August 2020, I launched Big Book of R, a collection of free (and some paid) R programming books organised by categories like Geospatial, Statistics, Packages and many more.
